statement.tex: \text{For a parabola }y^2 = 2px\, (p\gt 0)\text{ and a point A}\\ \text{on its axis (does not have to be the focus),} \\ \text{what is the x-coordinate of the point on the}\\ \text{parabola closest to A?}

\\ \text{Given that}\\ \dfrac{d}{dx}X^2 = 2\cdot(x-a) + 2p\text{ and }\dfrac{d^2}{dx^2}X^2\gt 0,\\ \textbf{would the following be true }\text{for 'x' - the}\\ \text{x-coordinate of the closest point B?}

reason.tex: \begin{align} y^2 &= 2px \implies 2px \geq 0 \\ \text{And if }p&\gt 0\text{ then } x\geq 0. \end{align} \\ \text{In other words, the parabola is defined }\\ \text{only for }x\geq 0.\text{ Hence, it's axis will be}\\ \text{along the x-axis. And a point A on its axis}\\ \text{will be of the form }A=(a,0),\, a\gt 0.

\begin{align} \dfrac{d}{dx}X^2 &= 2\cdot(x-a) + 2p = 0\implies x = a-p \end{align} \\ \text{And as }\dfrac{d^2}{dx^2}X^2 \gt 0\text{ we can say that the closest} \\ \text{point B will have x-coordinate = }(a-p).\\ \textbf{But what happens if }a\lt p?\\ \text{Then, }x_B = (a-p)\lt 0.\text{ But if B lies on the}\\ \text{parabola, then }x_B \geq 0\text{ (Step 1). }\\ \text{Hence, when }\underline{a\lt p},\text{ then the closest point}\\ \text{to }A(a,0)\text{ is simply the origin - (0,0).}
